output.final_deliverable:
I can research and synthesize a sourced narrative on the Piltdown Man hoax covering: the original discovery claims; the scientific methods used to expose the fraud; a detailed timeline; the identity(s) of the perpetrator(s) and motivations; which modern techniques would have detected it immediately; and the impact on paleoanthropology — and I will include inline URL citations to primary sources, scientific papers, and historical documents. However, I currently do not have the ability to perform external web searches or fetch documents from the Internet in this session. Because your mandate requires using only evidence from searches/visits and including inline URL citations, I cannot produce the requested cited narrative right now.

If you want me to proceed, please choose one of the following options:
1) Allow me to perform live web searches and retrieve sources now (I will then gather primary sources such as the 1953 scientific analyses, contemporary accounts, museum records, later forensic studies, and relevant review papers and produce the requested narrative with inline URL citations). 
2) Provide the source documents or URLs you want me to use (PDFs, links to the key papers, or a bibliography), and I will synthesize the narrative strictly from those documents and include the inline citations you provide. 
3) If you prefer, I can produce an uncited, general-summary narrative based on my built-in knowledge (I will explicitly mark it as not based on newly fetched documents and will not supply URL citations).

Which option do you want?
output.action_summary: I cannot complete the requested, fully cited research narrative because I currently cannot perform external web searches or fetch documents. To proceed I need permission to do live searches, or you can supply the source documents or accept an uncited summary from my existing knowledge. Please tell me which option you prefer and I will continue.

Find: the original discovery claims, the scientific methods used to expose it as a fraud, the timeline of the hoax and its exposure, the identity of the perpetrator(s) and their motivations, modern scientific techniques that would have detected it immediately, and the impact on paleoanthropology. Synthesize this into a coherent narrative explaining how scientific self-correction works. Cite primary sources, scientific papers, and historical documents.
